Indicator Name: Percentage of new entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood educational experience, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of new entrants to Grade 1 of primary education who have attended some form of organised early childhood care and education (ECCE) programmes, expressed as a percentage of the total number of new entrants to primary education.

Indicator Name: Percentage of new entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood educational experience, female (%)
Long definition: Number of new female entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program, expressed as a percentage of total number of new female entrants to primary grade 1.

Indicator Name: Percentage of new entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood educational experience, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of the female percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Percentage of new entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood educational experience, male (%)
Long definition: Number of new male entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program, expressed as a percentage of total number of new male entrants to primary grade 1.

Indicator Name: Early school leavers from primary education, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students from a cohort enrolled in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year and did not complete the grade or level of education in which they were enrolled.

Indicator Name: Early school leavers from primary education, male (number)
Long definition: Total number of male students from a cohort enrolled in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year and did not complete the grade or level of education in which they were enrolled.

Indicator Name: Early school leavers from primary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students from a cohort enrolled in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year and did not complete the grade or level of education in which they were enrolled.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in early childhood education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students at the early childhood education (ISCED 0) level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the early childhood education level in a given school year. Within ISCED 0, early childhood educational development programmes are targeted at children aged 0 to 2 years; and pre-primary education programmes are targeted at children aged 3 years until the age to start ISCED 1.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in early childhood educational development programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students at the early childhood educational development (ISCED 0.1) level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the early childhood educational development level in a given school year. Within ISCED 0, early childhood educational development programmes are targeted at children aged 0 to 2 years; and pre-primary education programmes are targeted at children aged 3 years until the age to start ISCED 1.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in lower secondary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in lower secondary general education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female general education students at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of general education students (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in lower secondary vocational education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female vocational education students at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of vocational education students (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in upper secondary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the upper secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the upper secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in upper secondary general education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female general education students at the upper secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of general education students (male and female) at the upper secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in upper secondary vocational education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female vocational education students at the upper secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of vocational education students (male and female) at the upper secondary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in post-secondary non-tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the post-secondary non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in post-secondary non-tertiary general education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female general education students at the post-secondary non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of general education students (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female vocational education students at the post-secondary non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of vocational education students (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary ISCED 5 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students enrolled in short-cycle tertiary programmes (ISCED 5) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) enrolled in short-cycle tertiary programmes (ISCED 5) in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Education programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Humanities and Arts programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Social Sciences, Business and Law programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Science programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Agriculture programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Health and Welfare programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in Services programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in a given tertiary education programme, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in the given tertiary education programme.

Indicator Name: Percentage of all inbound internationally mobile students in tertiary education in the host country who are female, (%)
Long definition: Female share of students who have crossed a national or territorial border for the purposes of education and are now enrolled outside their country of origin.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in unspecified tertiary education programmes, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in unspecified tertiary education programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary ISCED 6 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the bachelors or equivalent level of tertiary education (ISCED 6) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at that level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary ISCED 7 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the masters or equivalent level of tertiary education (ISCED 7) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at that level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary ISCED 8 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students at the doctoral or equivalent level of tertiary education (ISCED 8) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at that level in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from tertiary ISCED 5 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students completing short-cycle tertiary education programmes (ISCED 5) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) completing short-cycle tertiary programmes in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from Science and Technology programmes in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female graduates in science and technology programmes expressed as a percentage of the total number of tertiary graduates in science and technology programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from non-science and non-technology fields in tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female graduates in fields other than science and technology expressed as a percentage of the total number of tertiary graduates in fields other than science and technology.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from tertiary ISCED 6 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students completing bachelors or equivalent tertiary degree programmes (ISCED 6) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) completing those programmes in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from tertiary ISCED 7 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students completing masters or equivalent tertiary degree programmes (ISCED 7) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) completing those programmes in a given school year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of graduates from tertiary ISCED 8 programmes who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students completing doctoral or equivalent tertiary degree programmes (ISCED 8) expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) completing those programmes in a given school year.

Indicator Name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education, percentage female (%)
Long definition: Number of female pupils entering grade 1 of primary education for the first time during the course of the reference school or academic year as a share of the total (male and female) number of new entrants to grade 1 of primary education in that year.

Indicator Name: Out-of-school children of primary school age, percentage female (%)
Long definition: Number of female primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in either primary or secondary schools as a percentage of the total (male and female) number of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in either primary or secondary schools.

Indicator Name: Out-of-school adolescents of lower secondary school age, percentage female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in lower secondary education as a percentage of the total number of lower secondary school age adolescents (male and female) who are not enrolled in lower secondary education.

Indicator Name: Out-of-school youth of upper secondary school age, percentage female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female upper secondary school age youth who are not enrolled in upper secondary education as a percentage of the total number of upper secondary school age youth (male and female) who are not enrolled in upper secondary education.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Education programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in education programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Education programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in education programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Education programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in education programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Humanities and Arts programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in humanities and arts programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Humanities and Arts programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in humanities and arts programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Humanities and Arts programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in humanities and arts programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Social Sciences, Business and Law programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in social sciences, business and law programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Social Sciences, Business and Law programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in social sciences, business and law programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Social Sciences, Business and Law programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in social sciences, business and law programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Science programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Science programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Science programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Agriculture programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in agriculture programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Agriculture programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in agriculture programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Agriculture programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in agriculture programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Health and Welfare programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Health and Welfare programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Health and Welfare programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in Services programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in services programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in Services programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in services programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in Services programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in services programmes.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in tertiary education enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in tertiary education enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in tertiary education enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of all male tertiary students who are enrolled in programmes in unspecified fields.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Education programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed education programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Humanities and Arts programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed humanities and arts programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Social Sciences, Business and Law programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed social sciences, business and law programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Science programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed science programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Agriculture programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed agriculture programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Health and Welfare programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed health and welfare programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from Services programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed services programmes in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male graduates from tertiary education graduating from programmes in unspecified fields, male (%)
Long definition: Share of all male tertiary graduates who completed programmes in unspecified fields in the reference year.

Indicator Name: Percentage of teachers in lower secondary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female teachers at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

Indicator Name: Percentage of teachers in upper secondary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female teachers at the upper secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the upper secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

Indicator Name: Percentage of teachers in post-secondary non-tertiary education who are female (%)
Long definition: Number of female teachers at the post-secondary non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 5 programmes in tertiary education, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students successfully completing short-cycle tertiary education programmes (ISCED 5) in public and private tertiary education institutions during the reference academic year.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 5 programmes in tertiary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students successfully completing short-cycle tertiary education programmes (ISCED 5) in public and private tertiary education institutions during the reference academic year.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 6 programmes in tertiary education, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students successfully completing programmes on the bachelors or equivalent (ISCED 6) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 6 programmes in tertiary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students successfully completing programmes on the bachelors or equivalent (ISCED 6) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 7 programmes in tertiary education, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students successfully completing programmes on the masters or equivalent (ISCED 7) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 7 programmes in tertiary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students successfully completing programmes on the masters or equivalent (ISCED 7) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 8 programmes in tertiary education, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students successfully completing programmes on the doctoral or equivalent (ISCED 8) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Graduates from ISCED 8 programmes in tertiary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students successfully completing programmes on the doctoral or equivalent (ISCED 8) level during the reference academic year in public and private tertiary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, pre-primary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary to male gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and lower secondary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total enrollment in primary and lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of official primary and lower secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and lower secondary, female (%)
Long definition: Total female enrollment in primary and lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of official primary and lower secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and lower secondary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for primary and lower secondary to male gross enrolment ratio for primary and lower secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and lower secondary, male (%)
Long definition: Total male enrollment in primary and lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official primary and lower secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and secondary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and secondary, female (%)
Long definition: Total female enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary and secondary, male (%)
Long definition: Total male enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary to tertiary, female (%)
Long definition: Total female enrollment in primary, secondary and tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of primary school age, secondary school age, and the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary to tertiary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for primary to tertiary to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, primary to tertiary, male (%)
Long definition: Total male enrollment in primary, secondary and tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of primary school age, secondary school age, and the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, lower secondary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary to the male gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, upper secondary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for upper secondary to the male gross enrolment ratio for upper secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, post-secondary non-tertiary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total enrollment in post-secondary non-tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official post-secondary non-tertiary education age.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, post-secondary non-tertiary, female (%)
Long definition: Total female enrollment in post-secondary non-tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of official post-secondary non-tertiary education age.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, post-secondary non-tertiary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for post-secondary non-tertiary education to the male gross enrolment ratio for post-secondary non-tertiary education. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross enrolment ratio, post-secondary non-tertiary, male (%)
Long definition: Total male enrollment in post-secondary non-tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official post-secondary non-tertiary education age.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from primary education, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of the female gross primary graduation ratio to the male gross primary graduation ratio. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from lower secondary education, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Number of graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education. The ratio can exceed 100% due to over-aged and under-aged adolescents who enter lower secondary school for the first time early or late and/or repeat grades.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from lower secondary education, female (%)
Long definition: Number of female graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the female population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education. The ratio can exceed 100% due to over-aged and under-aged adolescents who enter lower secondary school for the first time early or late and/or repeat grades.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from lower secondary education, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of the female gross lower secondary graduation ratio to the male gross lower secondary graduation ratio. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from lower secondary education, male (%)
Long definition: Number of male graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the male population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education. The ratio can exceed 100% due to over-aged and under-aged adolescents who enter lower secondary school for the first time early or late and/or repeat grades.

Indicator Name: Gross graduation ratio from first degree programmes (ISCED 6 and 7) in tertiary education, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female gross graduation ratio to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Gross outbound enrolment ratio, all regions, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of mobile tertiary students coming from a country/region as a percentage of the population of tertiary student age in their home country.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in lower secondary education enrolled in general programmes, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of students enrolled in general programmes at the lower secondary education level, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students enrolled in all programmes (vocational and general) at the lower secondary level. General education is designed to develop learners’ general knowledge, skills and competencies and literacy and numeracy skills, often to prepare students for more advanced educational programmes at the same or higher ISCED levels and to lay the foundation for lifelong learning. General educational programmes are typically school- or college-based. General education includes educational programmes that are designed to prepare students for entry into vocational education, but that do not prepare for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades, nor lead directly to a labour market relevant qualification.

Indicator Name: Percentage of female students in lower secondary education enrolled in general programmes, female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students enrolled in general programmes at the lower secondary education level, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female students enrolled in all programmes (vocational and general) at the lower secondary level. General education is designed to develop learners’ general knowledge, skills and competencies and literacy and numeracy skills, often to prepare students for more advanced educational programmes at the same or higher ISCED levels and to lay the foundation for lifelong learning. General educational programmes are typically school- or college-based. General education includes educational programmes that are designed to prepare students for entry into vocational education, but that do not prepare for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades, nor lead directly to a labour market relevant qualification.

Indicator Name: Percentage of male students in lower secondary education enrolled in general programmes, male (%)
Long definition: Total number of male students enrolled in general programmes at the lower secondary education level, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male students enrolled in all programmes (vocational and general) at the lower secondary level. General education is designed to develop learners’ general knowledge, skills and competencies and literacy and numeracy skills, often to prepare students for more advanced educational programmes at the same or higher ISCED levels and to lay the foundation for lifelong learning. General educational programmes are typically school- or college-based. General education includes educational programmes that are designed to prepare students for entry into vocational education, but that do not prepare for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades, nor lead directly to a labour market relevant qualification.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students in lower secondary education enrolled in vocational programmes, both sexes (%)

Indicator Name: Illiterate population, 25-64 years, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of adults from age 25 to age 64 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Illiterate population, 25-64 years, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of females from age 25 to age 64 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Illiterate population, 25-64 years, male (number)
Long definition: Total number of males from age 25 to age 64 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Illiterate population, 25-64 years, % female
Long definition: Share of the adult illiterate population (age 25-64) that is female.

Indicator Name: Youth illiterate population, 15-24 years, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of youth between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Youth illiterate population, 15-24 years, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of females between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Youth illiterate population, 15-24 years, male (number)
Long definition: Total number of males between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Adult illiterate population, 15+ years, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of adults over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Adult illiterate population, 15+ years, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of females over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Adult illiterate population, 15+ years, male (number)
Long definition: Total number of males over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Elderly illiterate population, 65+ years, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of adults over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Elderly illiterate population, 65+ years, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of females over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Elderly illiterate population, 65+ years, male (number)
Long definition: Total number of males over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

Indicator Name: Youth illiterate population, 15-24 years, % female
Long definition: Share of the youth illiterate population that is female.

Indicator Name: Adult illiterate population, 15+ years, % female
Long definition: Share of the adult illiterate population (age 15+) that is female.

Indicator Name: Elderly illiterate population, 65+ years, % female
Long definition: Share of the elderly illiterate population that is female.

Indicator Name: Adult literacy rate, population 15+ years, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female adult literacy rate to the male adult literacy rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Literacy rate, population 25-64 years, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of the population between age 25 and age 64 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of literates aged 25-64 years by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Literacy rate, population 25-64 years, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of the female population between age 25 and age 64 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of female literates aged 25-64 years by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Literacy rate, population 25-64 years, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of the female literacy rate (age 25-64) to the male literacy rate (age 25-64). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Literacy rate, population 25-64 years, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of the male population between age 25 and age 64 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of male literates aged 25-64 years by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Elderly literacy rate, population 65+ years, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of the population age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Elderly literacy rate, population 65+ years, female (%)
Long definition: Percentage of females age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of female literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Elderly literacy rate, population 65+ years, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female elderly literacy rate to the male elderly literacy rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Elderly literacy rate, population 65+ years, male (%)
Long definition: Percentage of males age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of male literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

Indicator Name: Net flow of internationally mobile students (inbound - outbound), both sexes (number)
Long definition: Number of tertiary students from abroad (inbound students) studying in a given country minus the number of students at the same level from a given country studying abroad (outbound students).

Indicator Name: Net flow ratio of internationally mobile students (inbound - outbound), both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of tertiary students from abroad (inbound students) studying in a given country minus the number of students at the same level of education from that country studying abroad (outbound students), expressed as a percentage of total tertiary enrolment in that country.

Indicator Name: Total inbound internationally mobile students, female (number)
Long definition: Total number of female students who have crossed a national or territorial border for the purpose of education and are now enrolled in tertiary institutions outside their country of origin.

Indicator Name: Total inbound internationally mobile students, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Total number of students who have crossed a national or territorial border for the purpose of education and are now enrolled in tertiary institutions outside their country of origin.

Indicator Name: Inbound mobility rate, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Number of students from abroad studying in a given country, as a percentage of the total tertiary enrollment in that country.

Indicator Name: Inbound mobility rate, female (%)
Long definition: Number of female students from abroad studying in a given country, as a percentage of the total female tertiary enrollment in that country.

Indicator Name: Inbound mobility rate, male (%)
Long definition: Number of male students from abroad studying in a given country, as a percentage of the total male tertiary enrollment in that country.

Indicator Name: UIS: Net attendance rate, primary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of students in the theoretical age group for primary education attending that level, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group. The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) calculates household survey-based education indicators using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS). School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Net Enrolment Rate" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

Indicator Name: UIS: Net attendance rate, primary, poorest quintile, both sexes (%)
Short definition: Total number of students in the theoretical age group for primary education attending that level, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group. The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) calculates household survey-based education indicators using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS). School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Net Enrolment Rate" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) calculates household survey-based education indicators using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS). School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Net Enrolment Rate" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Net Enrolment Rate" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Net Enrolment Rate" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

Long definition: Total number of students of the official primary school age group who attended primary or secondary education at any time during the reference academic year, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding population. The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) calculates household survey-based education indicators using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS). School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Adjusted net enrolment rate, primary" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

Short definition: Total number of students of the official primary school age group who attended primary or secondary education at any time during the reference academic year, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding population. The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) calculates household survey-based education indicators using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS). School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Adjusted net enrolment rate, primary" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

School participation in household surveys and censuses is commonly measured by whether pupils or students attended a given grade or level of education at least one day during the academic reference year. Therefore, indicators of school participation derived from household survey data refer to attendance, e.g. “net attendance rate” or “adjusted net attendance rate”. The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Total net enrolment rate, lower secondary" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

The comparable indicator for administrative data is "Total net enrolment rate, lower secondary" because the data is based on numbers of students officially enrolled in educational institutions in the stated year. Each poverty quintile represents one fifth of students with quintile 1 being the poorest 20 percent of students and quintile 5 being the richest 20 percent of students. For more information, consult the UIS website: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/

Indicator Name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood education experience , both sexes (number)
Long definition: New entrants to the first grade of primary education who have previously been enrolled in any pre-primary or early childhood educational development programme.

Indicator Name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education with early childhood education experience, female (number)
Long definition: New female entrants to the first grade of primary education who have previously been enrolled in any pre-primary or early childhood educational development programme.

Indicator Name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education, both sexes (number)
Long definition: Number of pupils entering primary education for the first time during the course of the reference school or academic year.

Indicator Name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education, female (number)
Long definition: Number of female pupils entering primary education for the first time during the course of the reference school or academic year.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, pre-primary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net enrolment rate for pre-primary to the male net enrolment rate for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, primary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net enrolment rate for primary to the male net enrolment rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, lower secondary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of students in the theoretical age group for lower secondary education enrolled in that level, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group. Divide the number of students enrolled who are of the official age group for lower secondary education by the population for the same age group and multiply the result by 100. NER at each level of education should be based on enrolment of the relevant age group in all types of schools and education institutions, including public, private and all other institutions that provide organized educational programmes.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, lower secondary, female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students in the theoretical age group for lower secondary education enrolled in that level, expressed as a percentage of the total female population in that age group. Divide the number of female students enrolled who are of the official age group for lower secondary education by the female population for the same age group and multiply the result by 100. NER at each level of education should be based on enrolment of the relevant age group in all types of schools and education institutions, including public, private and all other institutions that provide organized educational programmes.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, lower secondary, male (%)
Long definition: Total number of male students in the theoretical age group for lower secondary education enrolled in that level, expressed as a percentage of the total male population in that age group. Divide the number of male students enrolled who are of the official age group for lower secondary education by the male population for the same age group and multiply the result by 100. NER at each level of education should be based on enrolment of the relevant age group in all types of schools and education institutions, including public, private and all other institutions that provide organized educational programmes.

Indicator Name: Net enrolment rate, secondary, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net enrolment rate for secondary to the male net enrolment rate for secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Adjusted net enrolment rate, primary, gender parity index (GPI)

In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Adjusted net enrolment rate, lower secondary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of students of the official lower secondary school age group who are enrolled in lower secondary education or higher, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding population. Divide the total number of students in the official lower secondary school age range who are enrolled in lower secondary education or higher by the population of the same age group and multiply the result by 100. NERA should be based on total enrolment of the official school participation age group for all types of schools and education institutions, including public, private and all other institutions that provide organized educational programmes.

Long definition: Total number of female students of the official lower secondary school age group who are enrolled in lower secondary education or higher, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding female population. Indicator Name: Adjusted net enrolment rate, upper secondary, male (%)
Long definition: Total number of male students of the official upper secondary school age group who are enrolled in upper secondary education or higher, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding male population. Divide the total number of male students in the official upper secondary school age range who are enrolled in upper secondary education or higher by the male population of the same age group and multiply the result by 100. Indicator Name: Total net enrolment rate, primary, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of students of the official age group for primary education who are enrolled in any level of education, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding population. Divide the total number of students in the official school age range for primary education who are enrolled in any level of education by the population of the same age group and multiply the result by 100. The difference between the total NER and the adjusted NER provides a measure of the proportion of children in the official relevant school age group who are enrolled in levels of education below the one intended for their age. The difference between the total NER and the adjusted NER for primary education is due to enrolment in pre-primary education. The total NER should be based on total enrolment of the official relevant school age group in any level of education for all types of schools and education institutions, including public, private and all other institutions that provide organized educational programmes.

Indicator Name: Total net enrolment rate, primary, female (%)
Long definition: Total number of female students of the official age group for primary education who are enrolled in any level of education, expressed as a percentage of the corresponding female population. The difference between the total NER and the adjusted NER provides a measure of the proportion of children in the official relevant school age group who are enrolled in levels of education below the one intended for their age. The difference between the total NER and the adjusted NER for primary education is due to enrolment in pre-primary education. Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by under-age entrants (-1 year), both sexes (%)
Long definition: Number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by under-age entrants (-1 year), female (%)
Long definition: Number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by under-age entrants (-1 year), gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net intake rate to grade 1 of primary education by under-age entrants to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by under-age entrants (-1 year), male (%)
Long definition: Number of new male entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year younger than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by over-age entrants (+1 year), both sexes (%)
Long definition: Number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by over-age entrants (+1 year), female (%)
Long definition: Number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by over-age entrants (+1 year), gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net intake rate to grade 1 of primary education by over-age entrants to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education by over-age entrants (+1 year), male (%)
Long definition: Number of new male entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of the primary school entrance age.

Indicator Name: Net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education, gender parity index (GPI)
Long definition: Ratio of female net intake rate for primary to the male net intake rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Adjusted net intake rate to Grade 1 of primary education, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total enrolment in primary education of the official primary school entrance age, as a percentage of the population of the same age in a given school year. It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age. Divide the number of students in the official primary school entrance age who are enrolled in primary education, regardless of the year of entrance, grade or repetition, by the population of the same age, and multiply the result by 100. Adjusted NIR should be based on total enrolment of all children of the official primary school entrance age in all types of schools that provide organized educational programmes, including public and private institutions. It must be ensured that the enrolment data cover pupils who enter primary school earlier and might repeat the first grade or be at higher grades. While the Net intake rate (NIR) measures timely access to primary school for the official entrance age, the NIRA captures actual access to primary school for the total population of the official entrance age. It reflects efforts made by governments to achieve universal entrance to primary education of the eligible population of the official primary school entrance age. Adjusted NIR gives the proportion of children of the official primary school entrance age that are enrolled in primary education level but not necessary for the first time or in the first grade.

It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age. Divide the number of female students in the official primary school entrance age who are enrolled in primary education, regardless of the year of entrance, grade or repetition, by the female population of the same age, and multiply the result by 100. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

Indicator Name: Percentage of students enrolled in primary education who are over-age, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Total number of over-age students in primary education institutions as a percentage of total enrolments in primary education institutions.

Indicator Name: Over-age enrolment ratio in primary education, both sexes (%)
Long definition: Percentage of the primary school age population that is over the official primary school age.
